Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: G. Scott Barrett
Reviews.Content: What a great phone/camera.  Be sure to grab the free Nokia Pro Cam app.  It lets you tweak settings like white balance, ISO, manual focus, exposure, and other settings. The photos are unreal.The phone also comes with a full version of Microsoft Office.  My fear of ditching my Blackberry has all but disappeared.  Office works like a champ.Another feature is the ability to block numbers from the call history or messaging inbox.  I rarely use it but it has been useful in blocking calls from Time Warner Cable.

Reviews.Title: Productive, Elegant, and Affordable
Reviews.Author: Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I decided to give this phone a try and I loved it. From the very beginning, I saw that this phone was meant for business users. While the UI isn't as flashy as android, there is no lag, no constant avertisements, and it was integrated with all the MS products that I use for school and work. Best of all, I really loved the way everything just worked. I have not expericenced a single crash or had to search the app store for something that should have been included with the phone in the first place. The only downside to this phone was, of course, the app store itself. Although, I never play games or use social media, certain utility and financial companies, do not have an app for WP8. I was a little unhappy, but I would glady use a web-browser page in the meantime.If you just want a phone that just works, I highly recommend giving this one a try. The os is smooth, your privacy is respected, and you don't have spam in your face 24/7. It gets you in and out of your life without requiring you to spend hours of your time on the web looking for solutions and reviews for the most basic applications.

Reviews.Title: Excellent work Nokia and Microsoft..
Reviews.Author: Kenneth W. Chambers
Reviews.Content: I love how people give a product a bad review for the company that runs it, not the actual phone.  4G for me runs great for me!! This is not even the top of the line 1025 and it has so much more functionality than the iPhone 5s.  I am sure that the iPhone 5.xxx or 6.x will catch up at some point .. :) It is funny because I was so much into Apple products for the last 10 years, considering a different product would have been uncivilized until Apple released IOS7.  What a piece of crap!  This Nokia 925 is fast, easy to use and I must admit Microsoft finally got it right with this OS unlike Window's 6.5 they tried years ago.  I love the media and others talking about the massive APP store with Android and IOS because the windows store has the majority of the key APPS and adding hundreds of APPS every week.  Most of the APPS in the IOS and Android stores are crap anyway so if you remove the crap from all the stores how many APPS are there amongst the different stores.  Nice job Nokia/Microsoft, keep improving and stay the course.  Smart people will eventually start migrating over as long as you maintain a quality product like these lines of phones and the Surface tablet.

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery and awesome phone
Reviews.Author: Cristian Ortega Gómez
Reviews.Content: I'm from Europe and this phone came with an European power adaptor.I absolutely love the phone. Windows Phone is the best operating system ever. Nothing more to add, just buy it. You'll love it!

Reviews.Title: Best Windows Phone 8 mid 2013
Reviews.Author: hp
Reviews.Content: The best Windows Phone as of 7/2013 in my opinion.Pros:-Build: Looks great, especially in white.  Almost zero gap.  There is some creaking from the back plastic but no flex in the phone itself.  I like the metal surround compared to the all plastic Nokias/Windows Phones.-Size: Not too big, not too small.-Screen: Not the highest pixel density but great contrast from the OLED.-Reliability: What Nokia is known for (with some embarrassing exceptions).  No issues with the hardware including LTE.-Camera: Not as great as the 1020 but good.  Also, the 1020 looks weird with the camera hump.  However, I don't take pictures with my phone.Cons:-Software: Both Windows Phone 8 and Apps.  MS was late to the smartphone game (due to a hard reset) and it shows.  Common things like being able to change the ringer volume and media volume separately and having a notification light is difficult/missing.  However, the OS is very stable.  App store is a disaster with no support from Google (of course) and lack of basic apps.  The update cycle from MS is slower than Android or iOS which is insane considering they are behind in the first place.-Specs: Absolute mid-tier compared to Android phones.  However, considering Windows Phone OS is more streamlined (limited/basic?) there seems to be no performance issues.-No micro SD card support: Enough said.-No removable battery: Seems like the trend but bothersome since it does not have the best battery life.-USB Charge port on top: Makes the phone upside down on the nightstand.-No induction charging without a back cover/case that must be purchased separately: Would be less of an issue if the case was not so ugly.Overall, a good phone and one I enjoy using along with numerous other (mostly Android) phones.

Reviews.Title: A good switch from Blackberry 7
Reviews.Author: Lyndon Williams
Reviews.Content: I owned a Blackberry 9780 for the last 3 years, and was enjoying it until I saw reports of Blackberry not doing so well on the market anymore.I started looking at replacement options. I'm not to fund of Apple iPhone and having to buy alot of apple gadgets just to interconnect.  I already have a Galaxy Tab 2, and I like Android, but not as a phone OS. So I decided to give Windows Phone a try.At first as with any change there is a little bit of did I make the right choice at the beginning. Then after about 1 month, I'm starting to love this phone. It's sleek design makes it almost invisible in your pocket, until you place your hand in your pocket and feel this slim rectangular device in there, and remember oh that's my phone.I'm pleased with this phone my only regret is I did not purchase it through Amazon, as it is cheaper here than at a local distributor.

Reviews.Title: Amazing phone, great camera!
Reviews.Author: Rebuiltearth
Reviews.Content: This phone is amazing and the camera is just brilliant.  The only issue is that some popular apps are missing in the marketplace but that is quickly changing.  The build quality of this phone is top notch.  The screen is beautiful.  And I love being able to use any type of gloves on the touch screen.  For the price this one can't be beat.  A must buy!

Reviews.Title: Most impressive
Reviews.Author: jBj
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Lumia 925 after cutting my teeth on a Lumia 521.Moving up to the 925 for me was an easy decision seeing how well WP fits my wants.Very elegant device!In need of a case for the phone since I'm terrified I'm going to something clumsy.Excellent piece of hardware.A definite winner in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Mitch Brock
Reviews.Content: I have been a Nokia fan ever since they came out with there first cell phone years ago. Several months ago I bought a Nokia Lumia 810 through T-mobile. A few months ago I had to send it back because it was having problems. Since they were no longer making the Lumia 810 at that time they sent my the Nokia Lumia 925 to replace it. And I am really glad that they did. Even though the Lumia 925 don't have the removable memory like the Lumia 810 with the built in 16 GB of memory I don't even miss it. Because I didn't have too much music are videos on my old phone anyways. Only a little over 1.5 GB. With 16 GB of space I still have plenty of space for all of the music and videos I had in the first place. The 16 GB of memory gives me twice as much memory as the Lumia 810 for apps and games. Plus there is still the 7 GB Skydrive that comes with the phone that you can also use for music, videos, and pictures if needed to free up space on your phone. And you can login to your SkyDrive from any were that the internet is available with any internet compatible device. I am also a big fan of the Windows 8 OS. I have been ever since that Windows 8 came out for the PC. I updated both my All in one touch screen PC and my Laptop the day that it was released. Both of these had Windows 7. The Windows 8 OS for smartphones is the best OS available on the market to this day. This is by far the best smart phone that I ever had. I have had all of the available OS they have on the market. I like the Windows 8 OS  better then all of them. The Nokia Lumia 925 also has a really great camera on it with a 6 ellament lens on it unlike 5 that come with most smartphones come with today. The 8.7 mega pixel camera takes great quality pictures/videos that are up there with very high end SLR digital cameras out there. If I was to tell you everything that j like about the Nokia Lumia 925 phone I will be typing for hours. Mater of fact I am writing this using my Lumia 925 phone. I can do just about anything on this phone that I do on my Windows 8 PC/Laptop. I take it everywhere I go. I even use Internet Explorer 10 which is included with the OS to do my online college homework. I also love the idea that it comes with Microsoft Office. And I can download Xbox games with it. Including Xbox 1 games coming some. And again with the 16 GB of built in memory I can download a lot of games on it plus still have space for other things like apps, photos, music, and videos. To top it off the Snapdragon 1.5 Ghz processes (my opinion one of the best processes in the world for smartphones) helps this phone run smoothly and really runs all of the apps and games really well. It also makes multitasking really easy. With this processer you can run many things at the same time. I am in my 3rd year of college studying computer information science in the programming field. And some of the classes I had to take covers smartphones. In my opinion I would recommend this phone to anyone that would like a really nice high end smartphone. And the price is right to. The main things you should remember is that Nokia is the number 1 makers of phones. The Windows 8 OS is number 1. And Nokia broke the mode when they made the Lumia Windows phones. Take it from me. I am now a computer tech. And work on computers and smartphones every day. The Nokia Lumia 925 is simply the best. And with the upcoming updates it will only get better. Thank you for letting me post my opinion.

Reviews.Title: This 925 RM-892 is the Global version in case you are wondering.
Reviews.Author: Quasitraveler
Reviews.Content: Note that the RM-892 version is for global. The T-Mobile/AT&T; version is RM-893. Below will help everyone understand:NOTE the RM-892 and RM-893 at the end of each line.2G Network GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 - all versions3G Network HSDPA 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100 - RM-892HSDPA 850 / 900 / 1700 / 1900 / 2100 - RM-910, RM-8934G Network LTE 800 / 900 / 1800 / 2100 / 2600 - RM-892LTE 700 / 850 / 1700 / 1900 / 2100 - RM-893I think this seller should give me a special deal on this phone for setting things straight about this version of the 925 for him. I would definitely like to have this phone. :)

Reviews.Title: Good device
Reviews.Author: Stephen M. Lerch
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great Windows Phone 8 based phone, and you don't need the 41 MP camera on the 1020, then you will almost certainly be happy with this phone. And the phone's 8 MP camera actually puts out some very nice snapshots that you won't mind sharing on Facebook or via the now-available Instagram.The phone's performance is "peppy" and I have not noticed any slow down at all. Switching between apps is very easy, simple and fast. The only thing I find odd is not closing apps - Windows Phone just expects you to leave apps open and they will eventually close themselves after a set amount of time of non-use. Yeah, you can do ctrl-q, but that's not really what the developers intended (which is odd).The Windows Phone 8 store doesn't have as many games as say, the iOS or Android ecosystems, but what is there is not bad. My favorite mobile game, Contre Jour, is available, though things like Candy Crush are not, which really has me scratching my head.If you are looking for a good camera, attached to an easy to use OS and makes good quality calls, then the Lumi 925 is a darn fine choice. Just realize you aren't getting all the apps (many of which people don't use, though some people DO use are still not available natively) as the Android/iPhone equivalents and you should be happy.

Reviews.Title: the best phone ever
Reviews.Author: alvaro
Reviews.Content: i love this phone, honestly it has nothing to envy to android nor iphone ... all the apps that i use are available at the windows store

Reviews.Title: There is no other software better programmed
Reviews.Author: Gabriela Hammerer
Reviews.Content: Im giving it 5 stars, because of the reasons im giving you next:1.- With only 1 gb RAM and 1 Ghz, it runs a lot better than any ios or android device.2.- The personalization. It's so personalizable, you won't even believe it. If your friend got another one of this, it will be imposible for you to confuse wich wone is who's.3.- Windows 8 is FREE actualizable. Not like Android.4.- Is very easy to use and learn.5.- Games run perfect6.- Last but not least, the camera. It's so amazing the quiality of that camera. Me and my family went to Disney World, we have a proffesional photocamera, but no, we took the photos with this little guy.Those were the Pros, now the contras1.- The Nokia Market (App store/ Google Play) has not that much of apps. But its growing, so in a year or so it will have a lot more (i believe).2.- It's hard to find a hardcase for this or any nokia lumia, due to the amount of people that have one.3.- Internet Explorer. I know a lot of people say Internet Explorer is bad (and it is) but not in the nokia lumia. Its like the safari in ios, but with another name/logo. But, (at least today 01/18) there is no Firefox/Chrome app in the market.I Hope this helped you for deciding if your going for this. To give you a final frase, I had a iPhone 5, and changed it for this. Without lying at all, if you compare the nokia lumia 925 with the iPhone 5, the iPhone 5 is total CRAP. :D

Reviews.Title: Not fully compatible with Tmobile US Network
Reviews.Author: Rene Leer
Reviews.Content: This is a European version (Model RM-892) of the Lumia 925 phone. On Tmobile's US network it can't attain 4G speed because it does not have the needed frequencies for Tmobile's US network. While the cellular and 3G work fine, the 4G doesn't work at all.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone!
Reviews.Author: CrisssC
Reviews.Content: I just got it and it is just like in the description. No logo, it came in the original Nokia box with original accesories. It was super easy to instal and to get it going.I have T-mobile and it works great.Great phone and seller!Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Such a functional phone :)
Reviews.Author: Taylor Bernal
Reviews.Content: First of all, I didn't get this phone from amazon, but God kinda just dropped it in my lap one day and I'm in love with it :) It's very functional, comes with a music player, which can play while you're doing pretty much whatever else you're doing, very user-friendly and easy to learn how to use, and the camera is incredibly top notch. My mom was trying to take a picture in a room with bad lighting using her Iphone and it just kept coming out looking faded and dark, but this phone (without even having to use the flash) took a crystal clear photo and it looks like it was taken with a quality camera. The phone is very slim and extremely light, the battery lasts pretty well considering I'm using it constantly (just remember to turn on the battery saver, apps like to run in the background without letting you know) Comes with some great gps, social and utility apps, and there are so many free apps on the store. I love love love it, and would recommend it completely :)

Reviews.Title: Best WP I've used
Reviews.Author: GG
Reviews.Content: Love the hardware, love the software (after updating to Amber & Black).Only issue is that I couldn't find a good case yet, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: Best phone ever
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: I've owned a lot of Nokia phones and this is by far the best one. Build quality is exceptional and I'm in love with Windows Phone 8 (I've tried Android for a while).Recommended if you want a phone that works all the time without lag or constant crashes.

Reviews.Title: perrrrrfect
Reviews.Author: milady
Reviews.Content: i bought this phone as a gift for a friend and they,absolutely love it, it came unlocked and works like a gem, great buy

Reviews.Title: i just simply love that ph
Reviews.Author: khan786
Reviews.Content: I love that ph the way how it looks its functions camera is awesome and the touch screen is lovely too

Reviews.Title: Great Phone but Beware
Reviews.Author: greatbear302
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome phone as far as usability and apps are concerned. Very lightweight as well, better battery life with more power saving options, and above all, allows me to uninstall an app (unlike my Gingerbread Android). I'm loving it.But this phone fails at one big point. No 4G/LTE compatibility with T-Mobile USA or AT&T; USA. Both are major GSM (sim-card) carriers. 1700/2100 MHz BOTH are required to get 4G signal. Just 2100 MHz will not work! Using ookla app the best speed I've seen on this phone is 6 Mbps download in an area T-Mobile USA advertises LTE speed. Whereas it should be around 15 Mbps (more than double) IF it could catch LTE.

Reviews.Title: Best WP8 Phone
Reviews.Author: Razvan Iamandii
Reviews.Content: Great hardware, great design and great OS. I just love it. Never had a problem with it.I will probably go for the wireless charging case to.

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone
Reviews.Author: Bing Liang
Reviews.Content: The camera is so amazing. The pictures I take by it have wonderful color. Windows is convenient and fluent. White is cute.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: S. Detwiler
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife to replace her iPhone 5 that wouldn't work with the new update.  she hasn't complained once with this phone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Adriana S.
Reviews.Content: I was already a Nokia Lumia lover and now I changed my 800 for the 925 and I am very happy! The phone is fast, beautiful, useful... I love it.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: robert g campbell
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for 6 weeks with multiple issues. I have a Windows 8 tablet and the phone will not sync calendar and contacts. The recommended Windows my Phone app is useless. It shows some pictures and the 5 of out 550 songs that successfully transferred from my itune account, another serious flaw by what is supposed to be a leading software company called Microsoft, and has nothing showing on the screen from this app for navigating or activating synchronizing or updating between the two devices. So email, contacts, and calendar will not synchronize between a windows 8 phone and a Windows 8 Tablet. Now every time I go to check e mail the phone wants me to update all my information for e mail address and password. So maybe there is solutions out there for all these problems but you pay $350 for a phone and it costs you $2000 in your valuable time, not to mention frustration, trying to get it to do the simplest of functions. The sync software, another real screw up by Microsoft, in my Lincoln, says the 925 does not support voice text for this phone; one of the newest model windows phone. So the 925 Microsoft phone is disc functional on the most important and simples functions with Microsoft Tablets and automobile software. Wow this old dinosaur company is a joke. I am done with Microsoft and good luck on their website trying to find a way to contact anyone to get help

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Harrison
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this purchase, the phone its amazing, everything was good with my order, I have no problems. I recommend windows 8 :)

Reviews.Title: no problems, excellent phone
Reviews.Author: kennethcrs
Reviews.Content: This Phone is amazing, very useful, simple and with beatiful design. The Windows Phone is excellent an the Nokia phones really haa madw it

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Eloi
Reviews.Content: it a good phone. I cant access all thing I need. and downloadge all game, music,video and more. it so exciting!!!!

Reviews.Title: PVCS truth in advertising and transparency REGARDING Nokia Lumia 925 unlocked phone for sale
Reviews.Author: Robert P.
Reviews.Content: I would not recommended the seller, PVCS, in buying an unlocked NOKIA cell phone for the following reasons.After contacting the seller on or about 14 January 2014 regarding trouble hearing voice calls with the Nokia Lumina 925 that I had bought on November18, 2013, I searched on the web to see if others were having a like problem.  Eventually found myself at following website: [...]After entering the data they required, model number and serial number/IMEI for the NL 925, I was surprised to get the following message: “Out of warranty in the US…… device was not designed for the us market: we do not have the capability to repair devices that were not designed for the us market. Please check the warranty information that was included with your device and/or contact your point of purchase. If you purchased the device in the US and you determine that your device came with a US warranty, please include a copy of your proof of purchase that confirms the device was purchased in the United States and a copy of the in box US warranty documentation when you send your device in for repair”.The only paper work that came with phone was in large part in CHINESE, and the part that was in English referred to support/repair facilities in Hong Kong and Macau.I contacted the seller—PVCS--regarding the above and their email to me stated “…This is what it says on out Comments, *NOT USA LTE,Check 3G Compatibility!* that it self means its not usa item.”I followed up with a response to the above with the following:  I am NOT questioning what it reads as much as WHAT IT DID NOT READ and DO NOT AGREE a conclusion could be made from “NOT USA LTE, Check 3G Compatibility?” one can leap to the conclusion that, in your words “its not usa item”.  I in fact did check with my cell carrier and was satisfied it would work with them. To be honest and fair with your customers, truth in advertising and transparency would suggest you should have stated what in fact nokia.com/us-en states on their website, that is: “This device was not designed for the US market and Nokia.com/us indicates they do not have the capability to repair devices that were not designed for the US market. Device therefore does not come with a US Nokia warranty and/or information on Nokia US based support services.”

Reviews.Title: PVCS truth in advertising and transparency REGARDING Nokia Lumia 925 unlocked phone for sale
Reviews.Author: Robert P.
Reviews.Content: I would not recommended the seller, PVCS, in buying an unlocked NOKIA cell phone for the following reasons.After contacting the seller on or about 14 January 2014 regarding trouble hearing voice calls with the Nokia Lumina 925 that I had bought on November18, 2013, I searched on the web to see if others were having a like problem.  Eventually found myself at following website: [...]After entering the data they required, model number and serial number/IMEI for the NL 925, I was surprised to get the following message: “Out of warranty in the US…… device was not designed for the us market: we do not have the capability to repair devices that were not designed for the us market. Please check the warranty information that was included with your device and/or contact your point of purchase. If you purchased the device in the US and you determine that your device came with a US warranty, please include a copy of your proof of purchase that confirms the device was purchased in the United States and a copy of the in box US warranty documentation when you send your device in for repair”.The only paper work that came with phone was in large part in CHINESE, and the part that was in English referred to support/repair facilities in Hong Kong and Macau.I contacted the seller—PVCS--regarding the above and their email to me stated “…This is what it says on out Comments, *NOT USA LTE,Check 3G Compatibility!* that it self means its not usa item.”I followed up with a response to the above with the following:  I am NOT questioning what it reads as much as WHAT IT DID NOT READ and DO NOT AGREE a conclusion could be made from “NOT USA LTE, Check 3G Compatibility?” one can leap to the conclusion that, in your words “its not usa item”.  I in fact did check with my cell carrier and was satisfied it would work with them. To be honest and fair with your customers, truth in advertising and transparency would suggest you should have stated what in fact nokia.com/us-en states on their website, that is: “This device was not designed for the US market and Nokia.com/us indicates they do not have the capability to repair devices that were not designed for the US market. Device therefore does not come with a US Nokia warranty and/or information on Nokia US based support services.”

Reviews.Title: Do not expect much from Windows or Nokia customer service or hardware quality and warranty
Reviews.Author: S. Yan
Reviews.Content: I have this Nokia 925. It was working ok. The windows OS is ok and should satisfy most ordinary people with no high demand for their phones. It gets basic things done. The quality of apps are definitely not on par with iOS or even Android. But you do have many of the essential apps, minus some of the hottest ones.However, the SIM Card tray is so fragile. Not only did the metal piece fell off because of weak glue, the entire SIM tray just failed to work after some time. I did swap SIM card many times, but I have done way more with iPhone and never had a problem. Nokia Lumia 925 just stopped recognizing any SIM card all of a sudden.After I send it in for repair, it not only took almost 2 weeks to get it back, they refused to repair it claiming "corrosion due to water damage or high humidity environment"  "and/or" physical damage.The phone was not water damaged. And even if it is, they can't just claim so but must show some evidence for it. If by physical damage, they mean I "broke" the SIM card tray, that's ridiculous because it broke because their poor quality and design flaws. If they have 50% of the sim card tray design quality of iPhone even since 2007, I am sure it would not break at all.PS: the screen is also not has durable as iPhone. It was in my pocket and all of a sudden it has a very visible scratch.So, if you need no fancy OS, buy this phone. If you just want to throw away the phone after it breaks, buy this phone.The only upside of this phone is that the camera is better than iPhone under low light. But the camera position is so poor that your fingers will always get in the way or smudge it.

Reviews.Title: fast, pretty but very serious storage issue
Reviews.Author: ChomskyKnows "ChomskyKnows"
Reviews.Content: OSMS runs behind in the app ecosystem, but you know and accept that when you buy this phone. It doesn't have a NEST or KEVO or whatever-it-is app. It just got Instagram. It's a chicken/egg issue (devs don't make apps without the user install base already there, while the base can't ever get there without the apps). If you can get past that (I can, I don't give a s*** about Instagram) the OS is fast, easy-to-use, different and a great alternative to iOS and Android. 4/5HARDWAREThis phone is beautiful and the processors allow responsive multitasking. It's very similar to the Lumia 920 except lighter, thinner. Of course the recent famous LUMIA camera tech stomps competitors into the ground. There's a key problem here. I just got this stupid thing and 1 day later it's already completely out of space. Although there are versions of this thing with 32gb, this ain't one of 'em. It has no micro-SD. Lesser Lumia models have micro-SD. Why not the higher end? While pics and other things can be offloaded to OneDrive, apps can't. I have no pics, no music, nothing but the OS and apps on this thing and it's out of space and nothing can be done about that...The storage space is such an issue that I may have to return this phone. The battery is also not replaceable and like most cell phones, leaves much to be desired. 3/5

Reviews.Title: Best Windows Phone out there
Reviews.Author: Raggamofing
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good windows phone, I'll recommend Nokia Lumia 925 is a good choice. I like Windows phone with the minimalistic interface; however I think Microsoft team has to  find a way to close background tasks better

Reviews.Title: Great Uncomplicated OS - Jury is still out on the hardware/firmware
Reviews.Author: Chris Lee Mullins
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my wife who was complaining about the complexity of the Android ecosystem. Really, she couldn't care less about multiple apps or widgets or rooting her phone. She just wants Facebook status updates, a decent Contacts app in a form factor that is somewhat smaller than the recent spate of monster-sized Android phones. (As an aside, personally, I use either a Galaxy Note 2 or a Galaxy S4, both rooted - she wants nothing to do with all that).This phone fit the bill perfectly. After a bit of a learning curve, she fell into a routine with this phone. Call quality is great. The keyboard is spot-on perfect for her smaller hands. She loves this phone.Well, she loves it when it works, anyway.Lately, this phone has been powering off at strange times. Sometimes it requires a soft reset to bring it back. Other times, simply plugging it into the charger is enough to bring it back to life. After a quick trip through the Googles, I'm finding that we're waiting for a specific over-the-air firmware update to resolve this problem.Thing is, that firmware update hasn't hit her phone yet. So...the waiting game.If your phone's OS is  8.0.10327.78, you are still waiting for the firmware update.Aside from this absolutely MAJOR issue with the phone's stability, its a wonderful flagship device for Windows Phone 8. Its really too bad that people don't give it a fair shake. Its not nearly as feature rich as a Droid, nor does it have as many apps as an iPhone. But there are just certain people out there who really...don't care about all that. They want the uncomplicated basics. Most of those people buy iPhones because family insists or have Androids foisted upon them by overeager Best Buy geeks. (nothing against the geeks - I am one)Those people should be looking at Windows Phone 8. And provided they get a phone that isn't broken right off the bat, I think they'll enjoy the experience.

Reviews.Title: Worst cell phone I ever had. Replaced 4 times in 2 months.
Reviews.Author: DJD "DJD"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great camera, light weight, beautiful design, nice operating system, good battery life.Cons: Screen freezes all the time, and the cell phone will die for no reason and will not turn back on. The only option is to get a replacement.Summary: Do not buy this phone at TMobile, because you will never get your money back or a different phone. You will only get replacements until you give up and decide to buy a new phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone and "strange service"
Reviews.Author: Xabial
Reviews.Content: Despite of having paid custom taxes, it was cheaper than in my country. Little weird that it contained a French SIM card inside, as it was brand new.

Reviews.Title: The jury is still out on this phone
Reviews.Author: Dwight Karlsen "Desert Bachelor"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give this phone 4 stars, but due to an extremely aggravating bug in the OS, I cannot. I bought this phone the first week it was available in the US, to replace my existing Nokia Astound (8GB, 8MP camera, Symbian OS). Mainly I wanted a larger, crisp screen and a more customizable interface, and of course a nice camera. WP and the Nokia Lumia 925 seemed to offer all of this, and indeed it does.In retrospect, I now realize that the trouble started one night in mid-September when I was exploring the different menus of the WP OS. I stumbled upon the very last item on the App list, "Wi-Fi Calling." I had never had a cell phone that was even capable of Wi-Fi calling, so I was intrigued. There are three settings offered: "Wi-Fi Preferred", "Cellular Preferred", or "Wi-Fi Only." Actually there is a fourth setting: Wi-Fi Calling "On" or "Off". I didn't really trust the technology yet, so changed the setting from "Wi-Fi Preferred" to "Cellular Preferred." Over the next month, a very aggravating thing began happening: I would pull out my phone to make a call, and get a "No Cellular Service" message. Or a message stating "You are in Airplane Mode". Or, "Cellular Service is turned off, do you want to turn cellular service on?" Reasonable responses to all of these messages never resulted in re-engagement of the cellular signal. In fact, I gradually discovered that the only thing that would return cellular service was to turn the phone off and then turn it back on, whereupon it immediately resumed its normal functions.I began missing phone calls from friends and relatives. Sometimes over a day would pass before I would realize my phone was no longer functioning as a phone. It was infuriating and extremely disappointing. I found myself apologizing to people who were trying to get ahold of me. Texts would not come through either, while it was locked into this Wi-Fi calling hell on earth. Naturally, the only time I got frustrated enough to take it back to the store was after I had re-booted it, and so it worked fine while I was at the store.I finally did some online searching, and actually stating my problem using ask.com revealed the answer: Choosing "Cellular Preferred" causes your phone to lock into Wi-Fi calling mode. I have turned off Wi-Fi calling completely, and plan never to use it again. It's not worth almost having a nervous breakdown over. I want to like this phone, but right now it is in the dog house, and it's going to have to work to earn my trust back.

Reviews.Title: DIDNT WORK OUT OF THE BOX.
Reviews.Author: AaronWysocki
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE....bought this as a present for someone in BRASIL..Didnt work out of the box...FROZEN ON THE NOKIA LOGO....now I am in brasil with a 500 dollar phone that doesnt work....lovely feeling!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very Fragile
Reviews.Author: Michel
Reviews.Content: The phone is beautiful, Windows Phone 8 is fast and efficient, but Lumia 925 has a fatal problem: The Screen !!!After his fall from my hand, the display, the screen crack !!! Yes, Lumia "Gorilla Glass 2" !!!Searching I found other users with the same problem. Small falls, serious damage. If you will buy this device, keep in mind that it needs extreme care, and if it fall, will probably break the screen.Too bad I'd say, especially coming from "indestructible" nokia phones.

ProductInfo.Features:
Full of Features - powered by Windows Phone 8, the Nokia Lumia 925 comes packed with great smartphone features. Work on the go with MS Office, enjoy free tunes on Nokia Music and discover the city around you with HERE Maps
Unleash your creativity - spend less time planning, more time shooting. Nokia Smart Camera mode lets you take a burst of photos, and then go back later and choose the story you want to tell
With award-winning PureView technology, Carl Zeiss optics and six physical lenses, the Lumia 925 lets you capture the great moments, day or night. And the beautifully crafted design will turn heads wherever you go
